Bonar Law.MiHouse of Commons, S.W.I.July,12, 1919.Dear Mr. Prime Minister,We, the undersigned. Members of Parliament of all parties, respectfully represent that the report of the Chairman of the Coal Commission raises issues of grave concern, and, whilst recognising the desirability of bating every possible step to meet the legitimate aspirations of Labour, we record our emphatic opinion that the principle of nationalisation has not been Justified by the evidence laid before that Commission, and that the policy of Nationalisation indicated in Mr, Justice Sankey/s Report is detrimental not only to the industries of the country, but to the best interests of the general public, of the workpeople and corsi^nars.We shall be glad if you and the Leader of the House of Commons will be 30 good as to receive at the earliest possible moment a deputation on this subject. The favour of a reply to Sir J. Harmood-Banner at the House of Commons is requested.Yours faithfully,I, Hamilton Benn. T.J. Bennett. Alfred Bigland. A.J?. Bird. Reginald B2air, J?.D. Blake. T.A.
